DataElement.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Liver Involvement Maximum Severity Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the maximum severity of acute graft versus host disease liver involvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Liver Involvement Maximum Severity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium.  It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg.  Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions.  It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._The largest possible quantity or degree._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Liver Involvement
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Property.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg.  Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions.  It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No liver acute GVHD / bilirubin < 2.0 mg/dL (< 34 micromol/L)

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping for CDE:2797671
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedObservation > PerformedClinicalInterpretation.value WHERE PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = "assess severity" AND PerformedObservation.targetAnatomicSiteCode = "upper intestinal tract" AND PerformedObservation > AssessedResultRelationship > PerformedDiagnosis.value = "GVHD" AND PerformedDiagnosis.diseaseStatusCode = "Acute" AND AssessedResultRelationship.typeCode = "assessment"
